inn1.comm: it's wide of the off stump and swinging away - the umpire, Daryl Harper - smiles and ponders calling it a wide, but decides against it
too wide, too full and Hafeez smashes it through the covers. Really fine shot
better length from Broad, just short of driving length and it's left alone by Hafeez outside the offstump
good ball on offstump, jagging back nastily to the right-handed Hafeez, the ball hitting him on his thigh
too wide to trouble Hafeez and he ignores this, shouldering arms
starts this on middle stump and it jags further down the legside causing Read to dive to his left, acrobatically - and Harper does call this a wide
wide, full and Hafeez goes down on one knee to hammer this over extra cover for four
and he starts with a wide. Poor start...but it does at least get Afridi off the strike. Every cloud...silver linings, and all that
better delivery from Lewis outside Hafeez's offstump and swinging away quite prodigiously. Hafeez shoulders arms

pitched up, straighter and swinging away from Hafeez who throws his hands at the ball but edges it straight to Strauss at first slip, who takes it in front of his nose. A wicket for Lewis in his first over again - great comeback for England
outside the offstump again, but a touch too wide and Younis leaves it well alone&
excellent delivery! Left alone by the right-handed Younis (who's in such brilliant form at the moment) but it was a testing, tight line on his offstump and angling away to the slips
straighter still from Lewis, swinging away and full enough for Younis to jab his bat down on it. Neatly played with soft hands into the covers
half a yelped appeal from Lewis and the cordon behind the stumps, but it's going down the legside
outside the offstump and, amazingly, Afridi leaves it alone.
good line from Broad, tight and straight and defended on the front foot by Afridi very watchfully
my word, what a ridiculously brilliant shot that is! Just short of a length and Afridi bunts it over Broad's head for a six.
great comeback! Enticing Afridi forward who prods meekly at it and it passes by his outside edge
this is a terrific response from Broad, pitching it up to Afridi and jagging back markedly, almost cutting the batsman in half.
and he shoulders arms again
left alone outside the offstump, swinging away
GONE! Terrific delivery from Lewis pitching it right up to Younis; on middle-stump and swinging away, Younis edges it straight to Collingwood at second slip.
a touch too straight and nudged into the legside
ah great bowling! Edged short of third slip - very well played by Yousuf, really, but excellent bowling
again in the corridor of uncertainty, swinging away a touch and Yousuf rocks back onto his stumps to play it off the back foot
neatly pushed down the ground
decent ball outside off, short and rising a touch onto Afridi - also jagging back to the right-hander who leaves it alone
lovely shot off the back foot, smashing it square of the wicket. Quite classical
that's better from Broad, swinging it away from Afridi who leaves it alone.
outside off - perhaps a slower ball, and Afridi laces it off the front foot, opening the blade to hit it square, but it's not timed quite well enough and third man sprints to his right to field
short of a length and left alone by boom boom
that's the length, right up there - allowing the ball to swing, and Broad is getting some decent inswing - which Afridi inside-edges to the legside
what a cracker! An absolute snorting snorter from Lewis, swinging away from Afridi and passing his outside edge
and again, more swing for Lewis although Afridi did pull his bat away...although he was still lucky not to edge it
oh my word, this is some over from Lewis. He's bowling some bananas out there, curving away from Afridi who once again can't lay a bat on it
too short, too straight and pulled with great timing over square leg for four. Awesome shot
fine comeback from Lewis, in the corridor outside Afridi's offstump - full, too, but Afridi plays it with soft hands into gully
Yousuf plays this very late off the back foot
false stroke...he tried to hit this into Derbyshire and missed it by a mile
oooh nearly falls into Pietersen's hands at cover, but it's just beyond him, as Afridi tries to hit this over long-on but gets a leading edge. Nicely bowled from Broad, getting some decent bounce
no, too wide - and called a wide from the umpire Harper
down the legside and that'll be another wide
much better line and length which is left alone by the batsman
outside off and it's left alone again
good end to the over, pitching it right up and just a hint of swing away from the right-hander
ooh what a ball! What a great ball from Lewis, squaring Afridi up who gets a leading edge which somehow evades the fielders
crikey, that's out - no it's not, ignore me, I'm getting too excited. Great ball again, on his middle stump and swinging away once more, played back to the bowler
banana swing away from the right-hander who plays it down neatly
too straight this time, allowing the batsman to turn it down to fine leg for a single
played off the back foot, too short to drive...Afridi looking very watchful against Lewis here
short and outside off, Afridi smashes it down to third man and Joyce pulls off a terrific diving stop to save four
but he starts well, Mahmood, getting a touch of movement away from the right-hander who plays it watchfully into the covers
reasonably well bowled but it's neatly timed down the ground
nice away movement for Mahmood - all three England bowlers have found some swing this afternoon - but it's too full to trouble Afridi who nudges it into the covers
and this time he loses his line; it's too straight, allowing him to nick a single on the legside
touch shorter and a bit more bite in that delivery, played off his legs
again too short and too straight
the perfect length from Lewis forcing the batsman back who plays it with a straight bat, holding the pose

and he comes down the pitch, attempting to clobber this over midwicket but gets  a leading edge down to third man. Rikki Clarke, on as a sub for Joyce, comes forward to take the catch but drops it. Oh. Dear.
played off the back foot
on middle stump, flicked away to Bell at square leg
a touch slower and Yousuf plays it off the back foot, very nearly deceived by the change in pace and nods his acknowledgement to Lewis
gone! Afridi falls this time as Mahmood pitches it up and he's trapped in front. That's as plumb as you get - absolutely dead. Lewis can breath a sigh of relief...and so can Clarke for that matter
what a ball from Mahmood, swinging away from Inzamam - and cutting away even further - who is extremely fortunate not to get an edge
fuller this time and Inzamam drives with typical laconic laziness to mid-on
no no, you can't bowl there. It's Mahmood's first wide of the day
clunked off the back foot to a shorter delivery outside his off stump
hello there...Inzamam moves across his stumps, early, but Mahmood sends it down outside his offstump. Strange move that from Inzy, who plays it neatly out into the covers. Neatly but watchfully
and he leaves this alone
outside off but, for once, there's no swing on offer. A swingless ball, if you like
great delivery on off stump, again no swing but Yousuf defends it watchfully on the front foot again
full-pitched delivery and cutting back into the right-hander, half a strangled yelp from the bowler as it his the splice of Yousuf's bat

wide of the off stump and cut past third slip - I almost jumped out of my chair there in excitement, but that's why I'm writing about cricket and not actually playing it. Yousuf was in perfect control of that
a legside drifter clipped off his legs by Inzamam
solidly defended off the back foot
the bouncer and Inzamam tries to hook it, letting out an audible heave, but it got through him too quickly
good ball from Mahmood, forcing Inzamam onto the back foot
nudged to leg
swinging in to the right-hander, excellent ball as Inzamam shuffles across his stumps
and again Inzamam shuffles across to the off side to counter the banana swing, pushing it out into the leg side. Could be a chance for lbw here from Mahmood
well bowled - excellent over from Mahmood, a maiden! It's a miracle!
tries to hit that through midwicket but Bell scoops it up
got up a little bit and that's defended downwards
pitches outside off and that's worked into cover
pushed on to the back foot, another dot ball. Yousuf's being kept uncharacteristically quiet here - he won't like that
defended once more, good bowling by Lewis again
a bit of a frustrated lash at that one off the back foot, doesn't get hold of it and it rolls into the off side
good shot, found the gap through cover and that's chased down to the cover boundary
on the backfoot and found an outside edge, down to third man, with the bottom hand coming off the bat. Not convincing from Inzamam-ul-Haq
hit into midwicket
controlled steer down to a wide third man, lovely
pitches back of a length, the ball doesn't get up properly and that's just casually defended
slower delivery and Inzamam judged that one pretty well, getting into position early, but he didn't quite time the huge pull he was attempting and gets just the single, after they run one short
defended
squared up a treat by one which swung a touch away and an outside edge loops up to the vacant slip area
another outside edge after Inzamam tried to crouch over that one
defended again
decent ball has Yousuf hopping out of the way of that one as he jams his bat on one which lands on a good length and just gets his bat on it
rocked back and squirted through square cover off for a rare boundary - the first in 63 balls
defended this time
pushed on to the back foot and that's defended down with the full face of the bat
lovely shot, just picked that up off the legs and tapped it up through midwicket and it races away with pure timing. Beautiful
and another delightful shot, creamed off the back foot through point this time. That's Inzi's third four this over, a bit of a turnaround for Pakistan
better length and Inzamam tries to work that through midwicket but pulls out of the shot
moves back on to his tiptoes to fend a shortish one into cover
fresh air shot at that one, which flirts past his outside edge. Yousuf still trying to settle in here

ooh, that looked and sounded like an inside edge onto the pad - and replays show it was - but didn't carry through far enough for Read to claim it, despite a big dive forward; the keeper took it on the bounce
a bit of a long hop and the batsman doesn't quite time it round to fine leg
Broad gets away with  a half-volley which Yousuf fails to hit back at him. The batsman's really lost his timing here
better ball to finish the over, right up there and the batsman can only defend it on the front foot. Another maiden
pushed right up there, the ball doesn't get up and Inzamam tries to work it to midwicket but doesn't get hold of the shot
great shot, a whip off the back foot - his front leg leaps forward as the ball goes square
defended
guided off the back foot with a drive through cover and that's cleverly gathered on the slide
right on the money and that's defended once more
banged in short on a good off-stump line and the batsman defends that one on the back foot
short, on the leg side, and Inzamam is quickly on that one with a dazzling flick off the back foot which he whips to fine leg for a one-bounce four
Broad almost goes too far in correcting the line, as it goes wideish down the off side and is left alone
fired in at the pads and there's a loud - but lone - shout for lbw from Broad. It's way outside off stump and is too high
good line and length and the batsman crouches over that one to defend
top shot! That's much more like it from Yousuf who stretches himself into a cover drive which he lashes away with much authority to bring up his first boundary after 48 deliveries
cut through backward point, parried down for a single
waited and works that off the back foot through midwicket
mistimed that one which trickles into the leg side
guided down to third man, who's yards in from the rope
defended this time
helped into the covers
Inzamam attempts to lash a cut, misses, and just narrowly avoids that shading his top edge on the way through to the keeper
good start from Collingwood, on a decent length and that's defended
tries, and fails, to work that through midwicket - in the end just gets bat on it and it trickles there
extra-cover drive and Bell sweeps that one up on the boundary
helped out to square leg for an easy single
puts that one on a good length again and it's defended on the front foot
a hint of swing and a slower ball but that's well defended
helped to the cover region
thinks about working that through leg but takes the pace off the shot
quietly defended on the front foot
rocks on to his back foot and whips that out to point; top shot but collected on the boundary
brings his bat down over that one to work it into midwicket
nudged into the legside
fuller and driven down to mid-off
ooh just a touch of swing there from Collingwood but it's neatly played out into the covers
miles wide of off stump and swinging away but Read snaffles it - a brilliant take, grabbing it with his right hand
pushed out into the covers
touch of swing again but it's too straight and nudged away to the legside
outside off and turning back into the right-hander, once again pushed out into the covers
nicely bowled from Dalrymple, full and straight and forcing the forward defensive
the batsman comes forward with a huge stride to meet the ball and smother the spin
a fabulous shot, smacking past mid-off for four. Super shot that, really marvellously hit
clever batting as Inzy pushes this out into the covers and nicks another single. Super cricket, this
Dalrymple roars the most unlikely of appeals
pushed out to the legside
outside off and turning away but he rocks back and whips it to leg
ah well bowled, gets a touch of turn and Inzamam watchfully defends
Inzamam comes forward and hits it out into the covers
too straight and Inzamam nudges it out into the legside
knocks this in front of square for another single
pushed back to the bowler
well bowled, Yousuf
pushed out to the leg side
driven to extra cover
tickled to short fine-leg
too straight and yet again they grab a single
outside off and turning away, pushed to gully
oh what a beauty, turning away from Yousuf who is comprehensively beaten.
Yousuf prods at this without moving his feet
ooh drives this in the air, but it's short of cover. Very, very close.
too short, Yousuf rocks back and pulls it .... but only for a single
too short from Dalrymple, pulled by Yousuf but again he finds the man at deep midwicket
and he ladles this into the offside for a single
touch too straight, Yousuf taps it to long-on again
ooh nicely bowled, inviting the drive and the batsman goes inside out to hit this down to long-off
batsman comes forward with a lunge to meet the ball, smothering the spin
GONE! Around the wicket, the arm ball - 79mph - and Yousuf chops it on! Massive wicket, and the end of a turgid 29 from Yousuf
forces this out to mid-off
GONE! Malik drives this straight back to Yardy, at comfortable height, who makes no mistake. That was a pretty poor shot
Yardy holds this one back but Razzaq forces it into the covers
nicely flighted outside the offstump and clunked back to the bowler
very well bowled on offstump, turning away
pushed out into the covers
massive appeal, mainly from the wicketkeeper Read, to one which turns sharply outside the offstump but it's going over the top
driven back past the bowler, who dives over the top of it, and they grab a single

got him! That's the big one, as it were, as Dalrymple angles this into Inzamam's pads who chips it, without timing and in the air, back to the bowler who jumps across to take a very fine catch. What a blow that is
outside off, turning back into Akmal who whips it to midwicket...and only just short of him, too
angled away to point
pushed off the back foot, neatly played
oh well bowled! Gets a leading edge which falls short of a short mid-off
and again, very well bowled and the batsman looks all at sea here against Yardy
gets bat on this but no run on offer
oh, so close! A late-cut which just evades Strauss's right hand at first slip. Cripes that was close
guided straight to midwicket
patted out to mid on
hit to square
flicked off the legs behind square
no power on that one which rolls to the leg-side again
driven out to cover
defended on the front foot
rushed that one out to point and it's scooped up
driven out to cover this time
edged and just wide of Strauss at first slip; he got his right hand to it with a low dive. A chance
defended forward
bent in at the righthander and that's squeezed back out, against the spin, to cover. Nice shot
more loop but well waited for and that's driven to cover
pitches outside off and the batsman reaches out, on his front knee, to play a premeditated paddle-sweep to square
defended off the back foot
driven to cover where it's quickly picked up
optimistic shout of "Caaaaaa-" from Dalrymple as the ball rushes on to the bat and he defends it forward without alarm
lashes that one to deep-cover with quick hands and an attacking glint in the eye
pitches on middle and that's helped into the leg-side
driven out to Bell on the off-side sweeping boundary and he throws it back into the bowler, as instructed by screams at that end
rushed out to cover
ooh, sharp spin at  a decent pace - 56mph. Nippy turn and bounce, there, and that leaves the batsman off the pitch, deceiving him in the turn. Like it
defended this time
pushed up there but that's well squeezed out to long off for an easy single
on the money and that's defended on the front foot
reaches out to paddle one that pitches outside off behind square
bump ball collected tidily by a diving Dalrymple and the crowd thinks it's a catch. It's not, but it does save a few runs
hit straight to the fielder in the cover region
stopped at cover
leaves room for himself to throw his arms into that one which rockets to point
comes forward to drive that to cover
driven to mid off
hit to point
more troubling spin and that's defended
tries to guide the ball with the spin through to third man, but that's straight to Strauss at first slip for a soft dismissal. Pakistan are really up against it now
drops that short, a rank long hop and that's firmly rocketed in front of square. A poor start from Pietersen - a gift in fact
guides that to short fine leg
short but a big rip into the batsman - still enough room for a drive out to cover, though
ooh, that turned into Shoaib and there's nearly a shout for lbw, but that ball was dong too much and would have missed leg comfortably
thinks about swatting that into the leg-side
hit off the back foot to mid-on, who passes it to Pietersen who in turn wings that back in to the wicketkeeper
pushed that one up and it's defended
similar ball, similar result. The spinners are doing a good job for England here
pitches that one right up there, on middle and it straightens as it bounces
driven into the covers for the first run of the over
the batsman pulls out of that one, dropping his bat down at the last minute as the ball moves away off the seam

oooh! Beautiful ball! A confident appeal results in surprise when the umpire isn't interested in one which pitches, straightens and feathers just past the outside edge (he was well beaten) into a prematurely-jubilant Read's hands
defended
defended again
tickled that one ever so gently to short square
pitches outside off and bends back into the batsman who plays it off the backfoot
defended into the on-side
defended
again that pitches on middle and straightens. Yardy's looking continually dangerous here
driven out to the cover boundary
that beats the batsman who plays over it, misses it and that hits him low on the shoulder
this time that hits the glove as the batsman tries to defend it
defended on the back foot
wild and woolly from Pietersen, down the legside and called a wide
too short, too wide and pumped off the back foot through extra cover for four. A four - a rare boundary indeed
and Razzaq goes for an almighty heave, looking to his this into France or beyond, but can only clunk it to mid-on
well bowled, fuller and straighter and defended
down the legside and whipped to fine-leg
skips down the pitch and drives, inside out, to mid-off
ooh lovely ball again from Yardy, taking the splice of the bat
too short but no single on offer there as he cuts it hard straight to cover
fuller and straighter, forced back to the bowler
very well bowled, too full (and fast) to do anything with
ever so slightly wider and cut into the covers, they scamper through for a single - dangerous, though, as it's Collingwood...but his throw is wide of the stumps
an ungainly mow across the line, completely mistimes it
blimey - he completely mishits this, attempting to clobber it for about 12 and ending up with none
turns sharply, and he jumps back to defend
clunked down the ground to Joyce at long-on who manages to keep it down to just a single
but he gets hold of this one! It's sailing high and handsome over midwicket - that is a monstrous strike from Shoaib, and a fine catch in the crowd
well bowled Dalrymple! Quicker ball, the arm ball, and it beats the right-hander
full-bunger but Shoaib can only hit it to long-off for a single

dropped! Shoaib absolutely laces this one off the middle, in the air to Strauss at cover who parries it, and it bobbles up...but he can't take the rebound. A dropped chance, but his hands must be ringing
and it's up in the air as Shoaib tries to hit this over Broad's head, gets a leading edge down to Joyce at third man who runs in and takes a useful, albeit comfortable catch. Broad has his man.
squirted down to Joyce at third man again
outside off, no great pace and is left well alone
ooh what a delivery that is, angling into the right-hander before cutting away from the batsman's meek prod forward. No appeal from the wicketkeeper or the bowler, bizarrely
angles this into the batsman, hits his pad and bobbles out to leg&
down the leg side but Razzaq can't get hold of it and it bobbles out to midwicket
well bowled Mahmood! A very slow ball, completely deceiving Razzaq, but it was misdirected really...aim at the stumps
short and slow again, they scamper a single to midwicket who flings in a quick return
and that's a wide down the legside, which gets a cheer from a healthy Pakistan crowd
outside off this time, and too wide
pushed off the back foot to deep extra cover, nicely timed
well, it's another slower ball but it's hopelessly misdirected. Too wide of the offstump and Rana reads it, clobbering it over long-off for four. Fine shot.
tucked off his legs down to fine-leg and they push hard for two
oh that's a superb shot, smiting it over midwicket for a four. Very well timed

swing and a miss - shudder to think how far that would've gone if he connected - and Read takes the ball expertly, whipping off the bails and asking the umpire...but Razzaq was safely back in his crease
oh, fantastic shot; outside off stump, too full and he creams it over cover for another four! Have some of that
down the legside, Razzaq swings this to deep square leg but they can only get a single
Rana comes forward, misses the ball which flies past Read down to third man.
the bouncer, Razzaq ducks underneath and it's a dot ball. But that's Mahmood's "lot" for bouncers in this over...
yes, that's gone! He climbs into this shorter delivery, another slower ball, and smacks it with a resounding clunk of the bat miles over midwicket.
down the legside, oh dear, it passes Read. Mahmood's losing it here, and losing it badly...it races down to fine-leg
and he just gets a bat on it, or something anyway, but it beats a wide fine-leg and it races for another four
that's into France! He moves to leg and swings through the line, smashing it over a wide long-off for another enormous six! This is carnage for England
outside off, Razzaq creams this over extra cover for four! Exhilarating batting from Razzaq, and poor bowling from Mahmood
slower ball from Mahmood and for once Razzaq can't time it, clunking it over the bowler's head
a yorker (at last), but it's dug out and pushed down the ground
it's gone again, miles over long-off! What a shot, and what an innings - absolutely crunching Lewis for another six
he tries to smite it over midwicket, but misses out and they take a single
Rana's at now, the attempted sweep ballooning the ball over the wicketkeeper's head. Neither fine-leg or third man can reach it..and they pick up a single as that's one short
this is extraordinary batting, absolutely remarkable. Another mow across the line; another missile over midwicket, yet another six!
never mind what Lewis can do, this is Razzaq's time and he creams it over his head for the biggest six of the lot.

inn2.comm: short ball, but just too wide to be of interest to the batsman who leaves it alone and it flies through to Akmal
short again, and left alone
nagging length and that was left alone once more
first time the batsman's had to play at one and that's defended forward
hit into the midwicket region
driven into the covers and that's a maiden to start with
left alone as that one bends away from the bat, not near enough to be of interest
left alone once more
yet again that's left alone
ooh, nicked one which went across him but that fell just short of Inzamam-ul-Haq at first slip
that one also slanted across Joyce and it was left alone
great ball, just slightly moving in the air as it pitches and moves away on the seam
half-volley lashed through point with a gorgeous cover-drive. We liked that one
slower ball, full bunger, and that's just mistimed to cover with a drive
good leave in the end, it just nipped back a little bit at Joyce and he jerked his body away in time
not quite timed as well as the first four, but with the ball coming at him at 90mph even that cover drive ran away to the boundary
coming round the wicket this time, that's quicker and Joyce rushes a drive at that one and will be glad, in the end, he missed it - that could so easily have been an edge
left alone
strayed down leg and that's easily worked off the hips by Strauss for a lovely ball
pitched on a good length in front of middle and that's quickly defended by the batsman, rushing his hands down on that one to jab it low
screecher of a good delivery; Strauss tried to withdraw the bat but after the ball had rushed past him and squared him up. Asif nods his head at the batsman as if to say "Well bowled, me"

oooh, great decision to call for the third umpire there. Strauss stands his ground after edging to first slip and doesn't think the ball has carried. The umpires wander over to confer - and indeed it hasn't, bouncing just in front of Inzy's hands
that one trickles down leg and Strauss helps it on its way, tickling it very fine and it goes all the way
rocks on to the backfoot, defends, and there is a loud call of "No!"
not properly hit, just slaps the bat on that one, an attempted cover drive
again, not properly played, hitting that one, an attempted on-drive, into the ground
the batsman walks across to meet that one, which pitches on middle, and he offers a defensive. Tidy bowling, this, from Shoaib
nicely played, just a push down the ground
defended this time
a little shuffle down the pitch and that's a nice straight drive
doesn't time a back foot pull properly and pulls out of the shot
defended this time
a huge shout for one which pitched outside leg and Daryl Harper isn't interested. Another good decision
responds by banging one in but it's a little wayward in line and it crashes into the batsman's top hand, with the bottom one flying off as he tries to defend
another good delivery seaming back at Strauss and Asif goes up in appeal - but it was far too high
short and the batsman quickly leaps on to that one,  nudging it forward and the batsmen run a quick single
dropped on a good length and the batsman just manages to squeeze out a defensive shot on that
wide on the off and that's whacked off the back foot through point and runs to the rope, beating the two fielders who rush off in fruitless pursuit
Akhtar around the wicket now and Strauss plays a cover drive with the full face of the bat, but it's scooped by the fielder
thoughts of a quick single are turned down
they chance the quick single this time and make it easily
ooh, good line and length and in the end that was very near the batsman's outside edge as it angles away
not even that short a ball and Strauss's aerial pull just to say clears midwicket and the batsmen scramble runs well
Joyce tries the pull shot this time, but doesn't quite time it and it flies up into space on the leg-side
lovely flick off the legs for two
angled across the lefthander and that's left alone
cover drive into, well, cover
pushed on to the back foot and that's defended
comes forward to meet one which pitches outside off but adjusts to guide that down deliberately to third man
left alone and that rushes through to the keeper
the bowler saw the man coming, dug it in short and somehow the batsman managed to get the ball to fly behind, very fine indeed
pushed on to the back foot by a slightly shorter ball and that's defended
worked out to square off the legs
rushes that one through; it pitches on off and moves away from the lefthander through to Akmal
a fuller ball and that's dug out with an attempted drive
tucked away off the legs to square
played into midwicket
great catch and that one definitely carried and Joyce walks straight off. Top take by Akmal behind the stumps, flinging himself low to the left and stretching out both hands to pouch that one
pushed right up there and that's defended first up by Bell
poor ball down the legside and Strauss simply whips this away, with great timing, wide of fine-leg for four. Commanding shot
leaves this one alone
pushed back to mid-off
it's down the legside and Strauss rather misses out here. Akmal makes a good stop to his left
clunked to midwicket but no run on offer there
a much better line from Rana this time, just on Strauss's offstump who comes forward to meet the ball and plays it out onto the legside
defended neatly on the back foot, angling the ball into gully and Strauss is very quick to respond and call Bell through for a single
good length from Asif but it's a bit too straight, allowing Strauss to whip it on the legside and scamper through for another single
short, outside Bell's offstump who rocks back and plays it with a pleasingly straight bat

terrific ball cutting back into Bell, missing his forward defence and rapping him on the pad. Asif and the wicketkeeper Akmal roar an appeal but umpire Harper peers closely at it...before shaking his head
a jaffa. That is quite beautifully bowled from Asif, holding its line before jagging back into the right-handed Bell and missing his outside edge. Akmal takes it to his left
defended on the front foot this time out into the covers
again too straight from Rana and Strauss has no trouble forcing it through midwicket
again down the legside but Rana is saved by the short fine-leg who collects Strauss's whip of his legs
elegant, laconic checked-drive but straight to mid-off
down the legside and called a wide this time
better, this time, forcing the batsman to defend his offstump, and Strauss does so with a push out into cover
almost induces a false shot from Strauss, but it's clunked into midwicket on the up...no run there
Strauss tries to drive this through the covers, gets an inside edge to midwicket and a misfield allows the pair to sprint through for a single
good line from Asif outside Strauss's offstump - good bounce generated, too - and Strauss pushes it back to him off the back foot
half volley on offstump and Strauss crisply strikes it down the ground, between the bowler and mid-off, all along the ground for four. Confident shot that
a slower ball on offstump which is defended
on middle-and-leg, Strauss turns it around the corner for an easily run single
Bell comes forward but not too convincingly, or with too great a stride, and gets an inside edge down to third man
once again it's a poor line to the left-hander who turns it past midwicket for another single
again on the legside but Inzamam's cannily placed short fine-leg saves the single (and the four)
pushed to a surprisingly deep mid-on and they steal a quick single
oooh very close as Bell pushes at this without moving his feet, the ball swinging away from the right-hander. Poor shot.
again no feet movement but nevertheless a solid shot off the back foot to a decent ball on offstump
just a hint of movement away from Bell who leaves this alone
loose and lazy from Bell whose attempted cut misses and it flies through to Akmal
on middle stump but it's bread, butter and marmalade for Strauss who works it to leg and they sprint through for a single
Bell looks for an expansive drive but, with a closed bat, squirts it to mid-on
and he climbs into this, down on one knee and hammering it square...Rana, at third man, sprints across and dives, stopping the ball, but parries it over the rope.
stunning shot off the back foot, just in front of square this time - short, wide, dispatched
and again - up and over and just behind square. Short, wide and once again clattered
very nearly four more but Bell misses out here...too wide, and rightly called so by Harper, the umpire
better from Razzaq, cutting it back into the right-hander who defends
drifting down leg and Strauss times it straight to deep square-leg
excellent ball to the right-handed Bell, shaping away from his back-foot defensive prod...although, in fairness, he probably just about pulled his bat inside the line
outside off and cut to cover
left alone outside off
drifts down the leg side, Bell whips it round to a vacant deep square-leg, sprints the first run and turns for two as the fine-leg jogs round to field
well wide of the offstump but Bell misses out. That was a gimme
good delivery on off stump, just short of a good length and Strauss is slightly cramped for room and can't work it to leg
again well bowled - Strauss threatened to come down the pitch - and he defends
ooh very full and worked off his legs
wrong line, again down the leg side and Bell, this time, turns it to Shoaib at fine-leg
powerfully clunked to mid-on
too full to cut, which Strauss nevertheless does and it bobbles out to the slips
that's a good line from Rana this time, on Strauss's offstump and swinging back into him
too short, allowing Strauss to cut but he finds point who fields it with ease
attempted yorker, misdirected wide of the offstump
driven on the up through extra cover, very fine shot indeed - and not a bad ball either. That really was a commanding, classic cover drive
rocks back and tries to square-cut this but misses out

a cracker! Rana's first jaffa of the day, I reckon, straight and cutting back into the left-hander whose attempt to work it to leg is made to look a bit daft. It passes his inside edge and he survives
quick delivery forcing Bell to clamp down on it
turned to midwicket...but straight to the fielder
that's a lovely shot from Bell, although fraught with danger - whipping it from middle-and-off to leg. Neatly timed for a single
outside the left-hander's offstump and chopped down to third man
pushed back to the bowler
leans into an easy cover drive from one which was wide and help yourself, and have some for your mates, too. That brings up the fifty partnership
that was a better ball, squaring him up and the outside edge flies past the first slip - too wide to be a chance - and flies away. "Naved hasn't deserved a second slip," tsk-tsks Nasser Hussain
long hop and have some more: Bell creams that through midwicket. Buffet bowling at its best (or worst, depending on which was you look at it)
cheeky single into the off-side
better ball, that; a bouncer and that's well played, the batsman content just to let that one go past, pulling early out of a hook
beautifully controlled cover drive to bring up Strauss's 11th ODI fifty, the second in a row. He's in good nick this week all right
drops down on one knee and sweeps that round behind square
defended
whipped into midwicket
more defence
pushed onto the backfoot and that's defended again
topspinner to end a tidy over
great bouncer to begin with, forcing the batsman to sway away from that one
fired right up there and that one's defended
left that one alone, which came in at 84mph
that one pitches short and bends right away from the batsman; an easy leave in the end
the batsman drops that one just in front of himself and he and Strauss rush through
edged well wide of slip and that runs to the third man boundary, which is quite short down there. That was a deliberate steer that way
cannoned in on a good length and that's defended
on-driven out on the leg-side
on the money and that's well defended
strayed down leg there and Akmal appealed to try to distract the umpire. Top clowning
defended this time
short and that's pulled away by Strauss who picked the length quickly
Bell opens his shoulders and guides that one nicely down to third man
right on the money and there's a clear call of "No"
Strauss got away with that one; a big looped steer up to fine leg but it bounces way short of the man on the long leg boundary
drops that into midwicket for a clever single
just short of a good length and again that's nibbled into midwicket for a quick single
pushed on to the backfoot and that's defended down
played off the back foot behind point
hit into the on-side
defended
a quick single to point
drops that one short and that's helped round to deep backward square
sweet cover drive runs all the way
drops wide and that's cover driven with Inzamam at extra cover not even making any move to try to get over it
quick single again
balloons up behind square
rushes that one into midwicket
comes forward to look for the drive, but ends up crouching over in a sturdy defence on the front foot
takes that one off middle and helps it to midwicket
the batsman comes down early for a premeditated sweep and gains an easy single
nicely bowled, some sharp spin which moves away from the lefthander
helped round behind square

well bowled: Hafeez induces a genuine edge which will run away for four and bring up Bell's fifty, his sixth in one-dayers. That came up from 53 balls and also brings up the 101-partnership from 108 balls
tucked up on the back foot to defend
comes forward to defend this time
slips that one round to square
turns that off his legs - well, actually his pads
cut off his back foot and that races away
that falls into the leg-side off the bat
pitches and does a bit, deceiving the batsman
helped square
pitches off the seam and leaves the batsman
well bowled - right up there and that's just dug out off the toes
premeditated sweep
huge appeal on the basis that the ball might have hit the pads first there, but Akmal was on his own with that shout
gone this time. That ball didn't spin and Strauss missed it completely - it clipped the top of leg. The bowler and Younis hug in celebration after Inzamam's change worked
a forward defence played very easily by Pietersen and Akmal shouts "Well bowled"
defended
good line and length and that's defended
played off the back foot to point
bowled well again and Bell can only defend
speared in a good length and once more that's dug out
windy whoosh at that one, well bowled; just past the outside edge and that goes through to Akmal
driven out to mid-on
easy cover drive for a languid single
Pietersen plants a big stride down the pitch and lofts that casually, without much power, into space at long-on
defended
thinks about cutting that one and it goes over the outside edge
worked off the front foot through square
short ball, quickly picked up and hit out to midwicket
driven off the back foot
Bell is flirting with danger here - he just goes on his front foot and was drawn into a needless fresh-air drive
well bowled again, just a hint of swing and Bell's completely done, but completely misses the ball, too. A jaffa
squirts a cut through point
what a ball! Totally does Pietersen... who somehow manages to survive that one, no idea how... It pitched on a good length and was that far from kissing his outside edge
clunked back to the bowler
attempted pull but he misses out here
ooh he plays this off the back foot but it falls just short of slip - well played, actually, angling it down
timed to mid-on, rather too well for Pietersen who then has to sprint to make his ground...which he does
lovely extra-cover drive but straight to the man at, well, extra cover
played off the back foot down to third man
mistimed over mid-off who sprints back...but can't quite make it
leaves this one well alone
ooh well bowled, Bell getting an inside edge out to square-leg
Pietersen shimmies down the pitch, shimmies outside offstump too, and pushes it forcefully back to the bowler
shoulders arms to this wider delivery
absolutely creamed off the back foot but straight to deep point. Cracking shot!
that's a superb shot, driving Razzaq straight back down the ground past mid-on. Fabulously driven with a high front elbow
dropped! Pietersen laces it - absolutely crunches it in the air, straight to Inzamam at cover who shelled it
Pietersen nudges it to mid-on, who is quite short, but he can't save the single
ooh Bell very nearly plays on here. A bit of bounce generated from Razzaq, cutting back into Bell who gets an inside edge

now then, that is one for the memories. Too good for Bell, too good for most batsmen I'd say, angling into the right-hander before cutting away. Just a fast legbreak, really, and Bell didn't have a hope
an 83mph loosener outside the offstump which is left alone
short, Pietersen pushes it out into the covers to grab a quick single
left alone outside off
attempted yorker, eggnogged down to third man for a single
ooh, Pietersen goes for an expansive drive but gets a thick outside edge which flies down to third man
cracking drive from Bell and Inzamam makes a good half-stop at extra cover
another squirted inside-edge which goes out to square leg

timed down deep midwicket and Rana has an absolute mare on the boundary...bends down to collect the ball, falls over; jogs after the ball, bends down to pick it up and woops! Down he goes again! The batsmen run four but Rana sees the funny side, as does Nottingham
left alone
punched off the front foot into the covers
good ball angling into the right-hander, and Bell is hit on the thigh. In fact, mere inches below the nether regions
the wrong line again, down the legside
angled into the gully
a big swing outside off, the ball loops over the cordon and down to third man...but wide of him, who eventually catches up with the ball and sends in a good throw
really well bowled from Shoaib, the perfect line and length, forcing Bell to defend his stumps
good ball swinging into Bell who digs it out
angled into the gully again
wide of the crease - wild, woolly and wide down the legside
oh shot! A fantastic cover drive which torpedoes across the outfield; that oozed class, commitment and power
slower ball which Pietersen misreads
good ball on offstump, defended with watchful wariness by the batsman
boshed into the covers without great timing
strange shot from Pietersen, a clunking sort of drive on the front foot when really he should have rocked back and pulled. No run there.
that's more like Pietersen, driving him down the ground with a big follow through. You can't bowl on his legstump, even if he's not in the greatest of form. It races past mid-on for four
a bouncer which barely gets up to Bell's shoulder, and he paddles it around the corner. Ugly cricket all round, really
one-handed push to Inzamam at cover
hammered with a wristy flick off the back foot and Inzamam pulls off a fine one-handed stop, in true Inzy style, hardly moving an inch
good running from Pietersen, knocking it to leg and scampering through
defended solidly on the front foot
deliberately cut up-and-over the slips down to third man, Razzaq fields
cracked on the up back to the bowler, in the air, but Razzaq shells it! Dear oh dear, you can't drop those. It was pretty well timed, but straight back to him
angled neatly down to third man
Pietersen skips down the pitch and punches this through midwicket, timing it quite brilliantly for four.
left alone outside his offstump
Pietersen gets into a tangle here, trying to pull a delivery which was too full and almost smashing the ball into his midriff. Impatience from the big man there
plonked out to mid-off for a quick single
on offstump or a just outside, Pietersen rocks back and smacks it Razzaq-style over midwicket but it falls just short of the rope.
extraordinary shot, down the pitch and flaying it through the covers, despite his bodyweight falling over to the legside
pulled around the corner
short and nasty, Pietersen evades it
slower ball down the legside. Good idea in theory, poorly executed.
slower ball and Pietersen hammers it through the bowler's legs for a four. That was hit with ferocious power!
nudged to mid-on for a quick single
again nudged to leg and Bell retains the strike
driven to extra cover
yorker-length ball from Afridi which Pietersen can only push back to him
very nicely flighted, beating Pietersen who comes forward and gets an inside edge
lands this on leg, driven back to the bowler
clunked into the covers
attempts to sweep this but it's too wide, and they run two. Three wides
pushed to mid-on but there's no run there
good length forcing Pietersen forward
wrong line, too straight and it bobbles down to fine-leg
bang on middle stump - very little turn there and it's punched to mid-on
a beauty to beat Bell! Turning, bouncing, and missing the bat
but a corking response from Bell, driving handsomely and crisply through the covers. What a shot
pushed to leg and there's a fumble at midwicket
woops! The ball passes the outside edge of Pietersen's attempted cut
tries to sweep and misses
late-cuts this to a short fine-leg
on leg stump, punched to long-on
on leg stump again and Pietersen simply swats it over the bowler's head for four! Great way to finish the game, one in which England have dominated for much of the day.
